str2: And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From peri and chora; around the region, i.e. Circumjacent.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From Gerasene. Of Hebrew origin; a Gergesene or one of the aborigines of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and echo; to hold together, i.e. To compress or arrest; figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To step in; I go onboard a ship, embark. From en and the base of basis; to walk on, i.e. Embark, reach.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.
